definition: lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Why so many peeps are jealous and hateful of China? Shouldn't we all be rejoicing! ? 2015-know what I mean?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼會有這麼多管中窺豹的人嫉妒和仇視中國？

sentences.english: From his life several clips can act.
sentences.chinese: 這從他的幾個人生片斷，可以管中窺豹。

definition: lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
the philosophy of materialism, doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
